display_title.display_title:
Tunisie – Projet d’investissement
            dans le secteur des transports (phase II) – évaluation
            environnementale : Aménagement des dépôts de remisage des
            véhicules de la SORETRAS

docna.cdata!:
Amenagement des depots de remisage des
            vehicules de la SORETRAS

repnme.cdata!:
Tunisie - Projet d'Investissements du
            Secteur Transports (Phase II) - evaluation environnementale

0.cdata!:
Transport sector management; Investments;
            Environmental assessment; Vehicle emissions; Storage
            facilities; Air quality; Vehicle operating costs; Air
            pollution control; Wastewater treatment; Lubricants; Oil
            spills; Sewage disposal; Rainwater catchment; Solid waste
            management; Solid waste recycling; Vegetative propagation;
            Tree rings; Septic tanks; Hangars; Repair shops

admreg: Middle East and North Africa,Middle East and North Africa
subsc: Sub-national government administration,General transportation sector,Railways,Central government administration

abstracts.cdata!:
The Transport Sector Investments
            Project, will finance improvements in services delivery, in
            coordination with transport modes, and integrated transport
            policies, to enhance the socioeconomic effectiveness of
            investments. Construction of new bus storage depots will be
            financed, both located away from town, along the route to
            the new fishing port of Sfax (v. 1), and outside El Bokri
            (v. 2), in the industrial area along the route connecting
            Tunis, and Bizerte, to be managed by SORETRAS, and the
            Societe Nationale des Transports (SNT), respectively. The
            new locations will improve the towns' high levels of
            pollution resulting from the current depots' gas
            emissions, lubricants, and oil spills. Cconstruction, and
            extension of the hangar, and repair shops at Sousse (v. 3)
            will be managed by the Societe de Transport du Sahel (STS).
            Mitigation measures stipulate: sewerage disposal shall
            follow sanitary regulations, disposed of at local sewerage
            networks, and at septic tanks installed at El Bokri, and in
            accordance with water supply regulations; rainfall effluents
            shall be connected to the external network for final
            disposal into the sea; and, wastewaters from vehicle
            maintenance, shall be treated, and disposed of in accordance
            with water authorities' regulations; lubricants, and
            oil spills shall be treated with sand filters, for further
            recycling at the Menzel Bourgiba station in Bizerte, while
            metallic wastes shall be recycled. Native vegetation, and
            tree planting will improve air quality levels.
